result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at It's Time Bar & Grill or Wisco Green Cannibis Boutique.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Zavarion M. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. except only to participate in school-sponsored extra-curricular sports. 
- Defendant may travel to France June 10 - June 26. During this time curfew will be lifted. If dates are different parties should file Stipulation and Proposed Order with the Court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with B. Encarnacion.

Plea questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to Count 8.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Deferred Prosecution Program.  

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #9, 10, 11. 

Stipulated Bail Bond Condition Change: 
-Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8:00 pm and 7:00 am. Except to participate in school sponsored extra-curricular sports. 

All other conditions remain the same.
